docs.snippet: After more than 21 million people watched the revived sitcom’s debut, the network moved quickly to lock down a second season.

headline.print_headline: ‘Roseanne’ Revival Renewed  By ABC for a Second Season
headline.main: ‘Roseanne’ Is Here to Stay: ABC Renews Highly Rated Reboot

docs.snippet: President Trump’s decision to place a tariff on aluminum has the beer industry angry over higher costs. How would the price of beer be affected?

headline.print_headline: A ‘Beer Tax’?  Metal Tariffs  Will Ripple,  Brewers Say
headline.main: Will Trump’s Trade Policy Fit Into a Can of Beer?

docs.snippet: The head of Vietnam's Communist Party advocated for the importance of market-oriented economic reforms on a two-day visit to old ally Cuba, which is struggling to liberalize its poorly Soviet-style command economy.

headline.print_headline: In Cuba, Vietnam Communist Party Chief Advocates Economic Reforms
headline.main: In Cuba, Vietnam Communist Party Chief Advocates Economic Reforms

docs.snippet: Federal criminal charges have been filed against four alleged MS-13 street gang members who police have said are responsible for 10 killings during the last year in and around Las Vegas, authorities said Wednesday.

headline.print_headline: US Prosecutors in Las Vegas Charge 4 Alleged MS-13 Members
headline.main: US Prosecutors in Las Vegas Charge 4 Alleged MS-13 Members

docs.snippet: In a broad expansion of the information gathered from applicants for U.S. visas, the federal government is proposing to collect social media identities from nearly everyone who seeks entry into the United States, according to a State Department fi...

headline.print_headline: U.S. Visa Applicants to Be Asked for Social Media History: State Department
headline.main: U.S. Visa Applicants to Be Asked for Social Media History: State Department

docs.snippet: Nebraska inched closer Wednesday to passing a budget that could deny federal money to Planned Parenthood of the Heartland, at least temporarily, despite furious opposition from a handful of lawmakers.

headline.print_headline: Nebraska on Pace to Pass Budget Targeting Abortion Providers
headline.main: Nebraska on Pace to Pass Budget Targeting Abortion Providers

docs.snippet: Officials have justified the war in Afghanistan as necessary to stopping extremists who targeted American interests. But the Islamic State, Al Qaeda and the Taliban all have a foothold.

headline.print_headline: U.S. Officials Brace for Return of Terrorist Safe Havens to Afghanistan
headline.main: U.S. Braces for Return of Terrorist Safe Havens to Afghanistan

docs.snippet: Mr. Liveris had served as the chief executive of Dow Chemical since 2004 and led a deal to combine it with its rival DuPont.

headline.main: Andrew Liveris to Step Down as DowDuPont’s Executive Chairman
